commit_message:
vmware: check for response body in error conditions

The response may not have a body in certain error conditions, like
a 500 on a socket error as seen in the VMware NSX CI. This fixes
an AttributeError when trying to access the response body in those
cases.

Change-Id: I086bb5bdb59813d326d45b5f7545da2ebb12aa95
Closes-Bug: #1517275
(cherry picked from commit b709dd62c16ffb0d924bf25328e29a3fbec0f36a)

commit_message:
Freezer instructions for Windows

Without tar binaries in freezer we need instructions to deploy tar
binaries, sync and OpenSSL on windows

Change-Id: I335ff7216ea15766d193c2193f93699abcda0b4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/14/248114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Python 2.7 - GNU Tar (we recommend to follow this guide to install them https://github.com/memogarcia/freezer-windows-binaries#windows-binaries-for-freezer) - OpenSSL pre-compiled for windows https://wiki.openssl.org/index.php/Binaries or direct download https://indy.fulgan.com/SSL/openssl-1.0.1-i386-win32.zip - Sync https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/bb897438.aspx - Microsoft Visual C++ Compiler for Python 2.7 http://aka.ms/vcpython27 - PyWin32 for python 2.7 http://sourceforge.net/projects/pywin32/files/pywin32/Build%20219/ Add binaries to Windows Path ---------------------------------------- - Sync - OpenSSL - Python - PyWin32
deleted_lines: - CygwinHowever Cygwin is required to execute backup and restore. The following binaries and dll needs to be installed: - bunzip2.exe - bzcat.exe - bzip2.exe - bzip2recover.exe - cygbz2-1.dll - cygiconv-2.dll - cygintl-8.dll - cygwin1.dll - find.exe - gzip.exe - tar.exe The .dll needs to on the Windows System Path. Install OpenSSL binaries from http://www.openssl.org/related/binaries.html and add it to Path: Install sync binaries from https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/bb897438 and add it to Path

commit_message:
Support for multiple UCS Managers

Cisco ML2 UCS Manager plugin us being extended to support multiple UCS
Manager instances within a single Openstack cloud.

Conflicts:
	All other files to be backported are in the networking-cisco project.

Depends-On: I890470a17b522b6e39a2578937c0537bcf4c09cf
Change-Id: I890470a17b522b6e39a2578937c0537bcf4c09cf
Partial-Bug: #1491025
(cherry picked from commit 7c50b028bec51cdb971896f40e1e2cdeef295104)

commit_message:
Add checks for VIPs network mapping

VIPs from network roles with mapping to non-existing network should be skipped
from assignment.
Added NeutronManager80 and AllocateVIPs80Mixin

Change-Id: Id8dd1d26872edd1e8055de5ebcaa2d7dd9a955f7
Implements: blueprint fuel-integrate-ironic (partially)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/19/242119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import yamlfrom nailgun.network.neutron import NeutronManager80 def _add_unmapped_network_roles(self): plugin_network_roles = yaml.safe_load(""" - id: "unmapped_role" default_mapping: "non_existing_net" properties: subnet: true gateway: false vip: - name: "unmapped_vip" namespace: "haproxy" """) plugin_data = self.env.get_default_plugin_metadata() plugin_data['network_roles_metadata'] = plugin_network_roles plugin = objects.Plugin.create(plugin_data) self.cluster.plugins.append(plugin) self.db.commit() def test_get_mapped_network_roles(self): cluster = self.env.clusters[0] self._add_unmapped_network_roles() self.assertEqual( objects.Cluster.get_mapped_network_roles(cluster), cluster.release.network_roles_metadata) def test_get_neutron_80(self): self.env.clusters[0].release.version = '2014.2.2-8.0' nm = objects.Cluster.get_network_manager(self.env.clusters[0]) self.assertEqual(nm, NeutronManager80)

commit_message:
Remove Python 2.6 classifier

We have decided to remove Python 2.6 support, this commit
removes Python 2.6 classifier before dropping any Python
2.6 support in code.

Change-Id: Idfd55ff59fe3ec599b92674aac9695ffdf7e8771

Define timestamp as extension attribute

According to the comments on the previous patch[1], define
timestamp as extension attribute here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/196959/

added_lines: Created_at and updated_at will be exposed to users via extension API. If plugin supports, they are returned when users issue resource retrieving requests. Also, resources list API accepts new query string parameter change_since. Users

commit_message:
Send bootstrap meta-uuid,if exist

Implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap
Change-Id: Iae2510f6dca65785938a69c1f0cc9f6c1eac5fda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent refs/changes/52/243752/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: BOOTSTRAP_META = "/etc/bootstrap_meta.yaml" def bootstrap_uuid bm = YAML.load_file(BOOTSTRAP_META) if File.exist?(BOOTSTRAP_META) bm['uuid'] unless bm['uuid'].nil? end :bootstrap_uuid => (bootstrap_uuid rescue nil),

commit_message:
Prevent to use physnet definition while creating 'local' networks

This is a intermediate solution on the way to dynamic physnets
and networks creation.

Change-Id: I53cf1c67b82ef8b14f2e1d69f22985ca6a69c0e6
Closes-bug: #1517853
blueprint: dyn-gen-physnet-set
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/59/247459/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $floating_net_type = try_get_value($nets, "${floating_net}/L2/network_type", 'local') $floating_net_physnet = $floating_net_type ? { 'local' => false, default => try_get_value($nets, "${floating_net}/L2/physnet", false), } provider_network_type => $floating_net_type,

commit_message:
devstackgaterc: Tweak plugin path for Kilo

Tweak devstack configuration for Kilo, where the new plugin path
is not available.

This change goes into stable/kilo directly as it isn't
appropriate for liberty and later.

Closes-Bug: #1516896
Change-Id: Iccd06ebefa76c1f240a04d10eeb0e40d1c15c7e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/33/246233/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else # project-config uses the new plugin path which is not appropriate for # kilo. Override it to use the old path. export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"MIDONET_PLUGIN=neutron.plugins.midonet.plugin.MidonetPluginV2"

commit_message:
devstackgaterc: Tweak L3 plugin configuration for Kilo

Tweak devstack configuration for Kilo, where we don't have
a separate L3 plugin.

This change goes into stable/kilo directly as it isn't
appropriate for liberty and later.

Closes-Bug: #1516899
Change-Id: I96da3d3b5b77f48170c5e2f6278767723b0a9836
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet refs/changes/28/246228/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # project-config configures the separate L3 plugin for liberty and later. # Override it as kilo plugin is monolithic. export DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\n'"Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES="

subject: Use server_profile_template_uri at scheduling
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-19 18:20:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/77d9ad10b40bbd160b6822a33f5b234de6e826f6', 'message': 'Use server_profile_template_uri to schedule

Since Server Profile Templates defines configuration options that could change
important properties on a node, it is important to give the user the possibility
use a Nova flavor to define which kind of configuration the server to be
scheduled can have. This patch changes the server_profile_template_uri from
driver_info to properties/capabilities so the user can use a proper configured
flavor to schedule an appropriate node with proper configuration.

Change-Id: I543a07c8978fae4adc29ccd23e7943429aa3186a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-19 19:57:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/ab1a42e112dcaa9e4b0d4d4dbcabace8ad0c1422', 'message': 'Use server_profile_template_uri to schedule

Since Server Profile Templates defines configuration options that could change
important properties on a node, it is important to give the user the possibility
use a Nova flavor to define which kind of configuration the server to be
scheduled can have. This patch changes the server_profile_template_uri from
driver_info to properties/capabilities so the user can use a proper configured
flavor to schedule an appropriate node with proper configuration.

Change-Id: I543a07c8978fae4adc29ccd23e7943429aa3186a
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-19 20:36:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/8e578bf5c485dd450bed975fc5ab81f1521b6186', 'message': 'Use server_profile_template_uri to schedule

Since Server Profile Templates defines configuration options that could change
important properties on a node, it is important to give the user the possibility
use a Nova flavor to define which kind of configuration the server to be
scheduled can have. This patch changes the server_profile_template_uri from
driver_info to properties/capabilities so the user can use a proper configured
flavor to schedule an appropriate node with proper configuration.

Change-Id: I543a07c8978fae4adc29ccd23e7943429aa3186a
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-10-23 14:37:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/16a45d8b749e619c9def44ecb275c231918c10ac', 'message': 'Use server_profile_template_uri to schedule

Since Server Profile Templates defines configuration options that could change
important properties on a node, it is important to give the user the possibility
use a Nova flavor to define which kind of configuration the server to be
scheduled can have. This patch changes the server_profile_template_uri from
driver_info to properties/capabilities so the user can use a proper configured
flavor to schedule an appropriate node with proper configuration.

Change-Id: I543a07c8978fae4adc29ccd23e7943429aa3186a
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-04 05:12:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/2c93d911be603b7c6fd4148763a375ff523a5875', 'message': 'Use server_profile_template_uri to schedule

Since Server Profile Templates define configuration options that can change
important properties on a node, it is important to give the user the possibility
use a Nova flavor to define which kind of configuration the server to be
scheduled can have. This patch changes the server_profile_template_uri from
driver_info to properties/capabilities so the user can use a proper configured
flavor to schedule an appropriate node with proper configuration.

commit_message:
Use server_profile_template_uri at scheduling

Since Server Profile Templates define configuration options that can change
important characteristics of a node, it is important to make this property
available in Nova flavors. That way the scheduler selects a node with accurate
configuration.

This patch moves the server_profile_template_uri from driver_info to
properties/capabilities so the user can use a properly defined flavor to
get a node with an appropriate configuration.

Co-Authored-By: Gabriel Assis Bezerra <gabrielb@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I543a07c8978fae4adc29ccd23e7943429aa3186a

commit_message:
Revert "devstack: Use midonet stable/v2015.06.2 by default"

This reverts commit dfe8a37dff90f000e24368be271211e5505ccd7e.

Because:
- it's wrong for v2 job
- it's no longer necessary as v1 job now
  specifies MIDONET_BRANCH explicitly [1]

[1] 9fddd82c7c9784ff86d459c584df48834193c0a5

Change-Id: I3855388587723e8d842556d5b62235aa492c097d
Closes-Bug: #1516898
Related-Bug: #1482080

commit_message:
Make Neutron physnet set generated automatically

Blueprint: dyn-gen-physnet-set

Change-Id: I7b3a07d36ffe10d73200397f2c0724869c57a9ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/68/245168/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================ Make Neutron physnet set generated automatically ================================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/dyn-gen-physnet-set Last time too many peoples interested two question: * How to make provider networks by fuel? * How to make multiple external (floating) networks? Unfortunately Fuel does not support out of box such features. -------------------- Problem description -------------------- Now we have a bush of non-optimal technical solutions in the Fuel library: * Order and amount of physnets for Neutron hardcoded in the fuel-library code. * For floating network used old, deprecated in the next release, method of plug-in. Combination of this leads to the following inconvienences: * End-user can't create additional floating network by standart manners without re-creating existing wxternal network and router and modifying plugin.ini on all controller. * Plugin-writers has no ability to add additional physnets. * Ml2 plugin has configuration, looks like deprecated ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- * Nailgun should make more-specifc description of physnets * Floating network should be attached through integration bridge (as private network now) * Parameters, like bridge_mappings, physical_network_mtus, network_vlan_ranges should be generated by puppet parser functions from quantum_settings/L2/phys_nets, network scheme, and node-type Fuel Library ============ There are 3 parser function should be written: * generate_bridge_mappings(neutron_config, network_scheme, flags) * generate_physnet_mtus(neutron_config, network_scheme, flags) * generate_physnet_vlan_ranges(neutron_config, network_scheme, flags) These function should be used while call ML2-plugin and OVS-agent configuration classes. Plugins ======= Plugin developers got ability for override standart physnet list. No backward incompatible changes planned Web UI ====== None Nailgun ======= Currently Nailgun pass to nodes following data hash (only valuable parameters shown):: quantum_settings: L2: phys_nets: physnet2: bridge: br-prv vlan_range: 1000:1030 predefined_networks: net04_ext: L2: network_type: local physnet: New data from the same configuration should be:: quantum_settings: L2: phys_nets: physnet1: bridge: br-floating physnet2: bridge: br-prv vlan_range: 1000:1030 predefined_networks: net04_ext: L2: network_type: flat physnet: physnet1 Data model ---------- None REST API -------- None Orchestration ============= RPC Protocol ------------ None Fuel Client =========== None ------------ Alternatives ------------ Do nothing. Leave post-deployment physnet configuration as hell. -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- None --------------- Security impact --------------- None -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- None --------------- End user impact --------------- None ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ None ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- None ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- None --------------------- Infrastructure impact --------------------- None -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- None -------------------- Expected OSCI impact -------------------- None -------------- Implementation -------------- None Work Items ========== * rewrite some granulas (puppet manifests) into osnailyfacter module * modify deployment graph Assignee(s) =========== Feature Lead: Sergey Vasilenko Mandatory reviewer: Igor Zinovik, Sergey Kolekonov, Sergey Vasilenko Developers: Bulat Gaifullin, Stas Makar QA: Anastasiia Urlapova, PI team, Neutron team Dependencies ============ None ------------ Testing, QA ------------ No changes for base cases. All existing tests should be used. Additionaly should be written noop-tests for cases, where physnet list should be extended Acceptance criteria =================== Acceptance criteria does not different from one for ordinary bugfixes to fuel-library. Standard BVT should be passed for ordinary configurations ---------- References ---------- 1. LP blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/dyn-gen-physnet-set 2. Description of new plug-in style for floating networks http://www.marcoberube.com/archives/248

subject: Create a software seam for Glance API code in Nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-22 19:05:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs/commit/51d4039883c815a63a46208189cc68f5ef8dcb83', 'message': 'Create a software seam for Glance API code in Nova

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/glance-seam

Create a software seam that allows future upgrades to Glance API, as well as,

commit_message:
Create a software seam for Glance API code in Nova

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/glance-seam

Create a software seam that allows future upgrades to Glance API, as well as,
performance and reliability improvements for Glance requests (i.e. reliable
uploads and performant concurrent downloads) without major changes to Nova.

Change-Id: Iab91d1340cf89699fcdc8fee3f273b3cb0f0fb80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/03/194303/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========== Glance Seam =========== Create a software seam for Glance API code in Nova https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/glance-seam Create a software seam that allows future upgrades to Glance API, as well as, performance and reliability improvements for Glance requests (i.e. reliable uploads and performant concurrent downloads) without major changes to Nova. Problem description =================== Feature: Glance Seam In order to abstract away glance API changes and allow for client side performance and reliability improvements without major updates of the client, As a consumer of the glance API I want a glance client library with a consistent API that abstracts away glance API differences, maintains client side logic for enhancing reliability and performance, and is designed in such a way that it can later be moved out of tree Use Cases ---------- Scenario Outline: Reliable Uploads Given at least one glance-api endpoint is available And at least one object store endpoint is available When a request for a snapshot is made And an ephemeral error occurs between <location1> and <location2> Then the snapshot succeeds Examples: Locations | location1 | location2 | | glance | object store | | nova | glance | Scenario Outline: Performant Concurrent Downloads Given <c> glance-api endpoints are available And one object store endpoint is available When <n> build requests are made And the build image for each build request is the same And the build image size is <size> Then at most <c> download requests from the object store are made And all builds will complete in under <time> Examples: Performance Criteria | c | n | size | time | | 2 | 1 | 10G | 30s | | 2 | 10 | 10G | 30s | | 2 | 100 | 10G | 30s | Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== A more general solution to use-glance-v2-api [0] that supports client side performance and reliability changes. See: Work Items Alternatives ------------ See [0]: - Doesn't solve v2 to v3 - Doesn't solve client side DRY or performance upgrades being minimal impact to consumer Make changes to python-glanceclient: - Possible technical implementation could be updates and changes to python-glanceclient and how it is leveraged in nova. This needs to be discussed as there are tradeoffs. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Other projects could consume this library Performance Impact ------------------ For the download bit: Download implementation would be modified in such a way to minimize total amount of data transferred while increasing concurrent data transfer for concurrent builds off same image. Additionally, mechanism for downloading would increase cache hit rate in glance. Other deployer impact --------------------- Once the library is split out, Nova will have a new library dependency. Developer impact ---------------- Once the library is split out, it can be leveraged by other projects. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: jesse-j-cook Other contributors: TBD: I will request -1 and comment to add id from people who showed interest to add here Work Items ---------- 1. Create seam a) Incorporate retry logic 2. Random order parallel downloads (Could be split into a new spec or sub spec) a) Get chunk list b) Randomize list (i) Want to download as fast as possible (ii) Mutex ensures chunk is only downloaded from object store to cache once (iii) Want to maximize concurrent downloads per node (iv) Operators can use deterministic routing based on chunk downloads to maximize hit rate and minimize duplicate caches across nodes c) Download a subset in parallel 3. Split library out of tree (Not required for this spec) Dependencies ============ Relates to: [0] Relates to: [1] Testing ======= Please discuss the important scenarios needed to test here, as well as specific edge cases we should be ensuring work correctly. For each scenario please specify if this requires specialized hardware, a full openstack environment, or can be simulated inside the Nova tree. Please discuss how the change will be tested. We especially want to know what tempest tests will be added. It is assumed that unit test coverage will be added so that doesn't need to be mentioned explicitly, but discussion of why you think unit tests are sufficient and we don't need to add more tempest tests would need to be included. Is this untestable in gate given current limitations (specific hardware / software configurations available)? If so, are there mitigation plans (3rd party testing, gate enhancements, etc). Documentation Impact ==================== What is the impact on the docs team of this change? Some changes might require donating resources to the docs team to have the documentation updated. Don't repeat details discussed above, but please reference them here. References ========== [0] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/use-glance-v2-api [1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-priorities-rax History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Liberty - Introduced

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/30/247830/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================================== Use virt-install and connect by using a local VNC client ======================================================== If you do not wish to use virt-manager (for example, you do not want to install the dependencies on your server, you don't have an X server running locally, the X11 forwarding over SSH isn't working), you can use the :command:`virt-install` tool to boot the virtual machine through libvirt and connect to the graphical console from a VNC client installed on your local machine. Because VNC is a standard protocol, there are multiple clients available that implement the VNC spec, including `TigerVNC <http://sourceforge.net/apps/mediawiki/tigervnc/ index.php?title=Welcome_to_TigerVNC>`_ (multiple platforms), `TightVNC <http://tightvnc.com/>`_ (multiple platforms), `RealVNC <http://realvnc.com/>`_ (multiple platforms), `Chicken <http://sourceforge.net/projects/chicken/>`_ (Mac OS X), `Krde <http://userbase.kde.org/Krdc>`_ (KDE), `Vinagre <http://projects.gnome.org/vinagre/>`_ (GNOME). The following example shows how to use the :command:`qemu-img` command to create an empty image file, and :command:`virt-install` command to start up a virtual machine using that image file. As root: .. code-block:: console # qemu-img create -f qcow2 /data/centos-6.4.qcow2 10G # virt-install --virt-type kvm --name centos-6.4 --ram 1024 \ --cdrom=/data/CentOS-6.4-x86_64-netinstall.iso \ --disk path=/data/centos-6.4.qcow2,size=10,format=qcow2 \ --network network=default \ --graphics vnc,listen=0.0.0.0 --noautoconsole \ --os-type=linux --os-variant=rhel6 Starting install... Creating domain... | 0 B 00:00 Domain installation still in progress. You can reconnect to the console to complete the installation process. The KVM hypervisor starts the virtual machine with the libvirt name, ``centos-6.4``, with 1024 MB of RAM. The virtual machine also has a virtual CD-ROM drive associated with the ``/data/CentOS-6.4-x86_64-netinstall.iso`` file and a local 10 GB hard disk in qcow2 format that is stored in the host at ``/data/centos-6.4.qcow2``. It configures networking to use libvirt default network. There is a VNC server that is listening on all interfaces, and libvirt will not attempt to launch a VNC client automatically nor try to display the text console (``--no-autoconsole``). Finally, libvirt will attempt to optimize the configuration for a Linux guest running a RHEL 6.x distribution. .. note:: When using the libvirt ``default`` network, libvirt will connect the virtual machine's interface to a bridge called ``virbr0``. There is a dnsmasq process managed by libvirt that will hand out an IP address on the 192.168.122.0/24 subnet, and libvirt has iptables rules for doing NAT for IP addresses on this subnet. Run the :command:`virt-install --os-variant list` command to see a range of allowed ``--os-variant`` options. Use the :command:`virsh vncdisplay vm-name` command to get the VNC port number. .. code-block:: console # virsh vncdisplay centos-6.4 :1 In the example above, the guest ``centos-6.4`` uses VNC display ``:1``, which corresponds to TCP port ``5901``. You should be able to connect a VNC client running on your local machine to display ``:1`` on the remote machine and step through the installation process.

commit_message:
Mounting changed shares on cluster update

When we update the shares on a cluster, we are now
calling the mount_shares routine anytime we have
new or changed shares so that the shares will be
mounted.  Unmounting of shares will be handled in
another patch.

Change-Id: I3456ea089f9eb005c842aa3a43bdce6da5daafe0
Partial-Implements: bp sahara-add-shares-to-clusters
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/31/246431/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sahara.conductor import resource as rfrom sahara.service import shares original_shares = ( self.db.cluster_get(context, cluster).get('shares', [])) updated_cluster = self.db.cluster_update(context, cluster, values) update_shares = values.get('shares') if update_shares: for share in update_shares: # Only call mount_shares if we have new shares to mount. # We only need one positive case to bother calling mount_shares if share not in original_shares: shares.mount_shares(r.ClusterResource(updated_cluster)) break return updated_cluster

subject: Configuration Resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-29 17:18:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-webclient/commit/fabf6fcee689a12b846b7587181a86d722fd1bd9', 'message': "[WIP] Configuration Resource

This updates, and replace, the $$configuration resource, in order to
increase test coverage, and to change its behavior to match ngResource.
Four methods of configuration are explicitly tested. First, explicitly
setting a cloud configuration during application config time. Secondly,
autodetection of available services using the default URL's provided by
those services. Thirdly, loading a server-provided config.json file.
Lastly, user-defined configurations provided at runtime.

Eslint was updated as well, as the indentation rules did not seem to work
too well with functions in function parameters being declared in a second
line.

Change-Id: I345b6f8e5da9d3064eabb3cc8cf0113e59626ac5
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-01 23:52:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-webclient/commit/71ed51b550e92b83403f58cb247e9fdb23182b84', 'message': "[WIP] Configuration Resource

This splits configuration management into two components, each with
a separate purpose. The first, $$configuration, acts as an ngResource-style
API abstraction that loads and maintains the list of currently active
configurations. The second, $$selectedConfiguration, provides the
mechanism by which a specific configuration is selected and validated.

New features added:
- A configuration may be force-loaded into the $$configuration provider
  during app initialization.
- The autodetection mechanism has been renamed to 'default'.
- The localStorage, configFile, and default detection mechanism may
  now be enabled or disabled (default disabled).

The main drive for this is separation of concerns and testability. When
writing tests for downstream API's, having to navigate the complex chain of
promise resolutions simply to load an API test configuration was
obnoxiously difficult. Separating selection and loading greatly simplifies
this. Furthermore, adopting a more ngResource-style resolution of
resources - where the object returned from a CRUD request will be the actual
data object in use, also simplifies usage in the user interface.

Tests have been provided, and testing threshold has been updated accordingly.

Eslint was updated as well, as the indentation rules did not seem to work
too well with functions in function parameters being declared in a second
line.

Change-Id: I345b6f8e5da9d3064eabb3cc8cf0113e59626ac5
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-02 01:13:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-webclient/commit/223ec4d7103d281efc6a086ca2f99e9646f301bf', 'message': "[WIP] Configuration Resource

  during app initialization.
- The autodetection mechanism has been renamed to 'default'.

  now be enabled or disabled (default disabled).

writing tests for downstream API's, having to navigate the complex chain of
promise resolutions simply to load an API test configuration was
obnoxiously difficult. Separating selection and loading greatly simplifies
this. Furthermore, adopting a more ngResource-style resolution of
resources - where the object returned from a CRUD request will be the actual
data object in use, also simplifies usage in the user interface.

commit_message:
Configuration Resource

This splits configuration management into two components, each with
a separate purpose. The first, $$configuration, acts as an ngResource-style
API abstraction that loads and maintains the list of currently active
configurations. The second, $$selectedConfiguration, provides the
mechanism by which a specific configuration is selected and validated.

New features added:
- A configuration may be force-loaded into the $$configuration provider
  during app initialization.
- The autodetection mechanism has been renamed to 'default'.
- The localStorage, configFile, and default detection mechanism may
  now be enabled or disabled (default disabled).

The main drive for this is separation of concerns and testability. When
writing tests for downstream API's, having to navigate the complex chain of
promise resolutions simply to load an API test configuration was
obnoxiously difficult. Separating selection and loading greatly simplifies
this. Furthermore, adopting a more ngResource-style resolution of
resources - where the object returned from a CRUD request will be the actual
data object in use, also simplifies usage in the user interface.

Tests have been provided, and testing threshold has been updated accordingly.

Eslint was updated as well, as the indentation rules did not seem to work
too well with functions in function parameters being declared in a second
line.

Change-Id: I345b6f8e5da9d3064eabb3cc8cf0113e59626ac5

commit_message:
Update /versions related API description

Add /versions (with HTTP 200 response)
Fix / response code
  remove 200 response for '/' (i.e keep HTTP 300 response)
Update version response example (adds v2.3/v3.0)
Remove comment out XML description.

Ref.
Source Code for URL definition
  https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/etc/glance-api-paste.ini
Source Code for URL handling
  https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/middleware/version_negotiation.py
  https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/versions.py
Test code for response
  https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/tests/functional/test_api.py

Changes
  Don't return 300 when requesting /versions
  https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/3fc253c197095f5f09846855a755b677ec37deb5

Change-Id: Id7052ece6a120bf63b086910460b57a7d0e7e15b
Closes-Bug: #1515022
Closes-Bug: #1404857

commit_message:
Update Identity v3 to match spec

Match the spec here:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/api/v3/identity-api-v3.html#openstack-identity-api-v3

Updated calls, parameters, faults, descriptions, and samples for

* API versions
* Credentials
* Domains
* Endpoints
* Groups
* Policies
* Projects
* Regions
* Roles
* Role assignments
& Services
* Tokens
* Users

Code samples: Removed unused code samples.

Change-Id: Ida11399456a4fa6ccff6336a02005192e1897a54
Closes-Bug: #1448602
Closes-Bug: #1513587
Closes-Bug: #1512305
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/27/230627/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: xmlns:wadl="http://wadl.dev.java.net/2009/02" xml:lang="EN"> A valid authentication token for an administrative user. xmlns:wadl="http://wadl.dev.java.net/2009/02" xml:lang="EN"> The ID of the authentication token. Filters the response by a specified description. Filters the response by a specified domain ID. Filters the response by a specified interface. '> Filters the response by a specified name. '> Filters the response by a specified role name. '> Filters on enabled or disabled roles. Values are true or false. '> Filters on email. '> Enables you to page through the list. '> Filters the response by a specified parent ID. Sets the page size for paging through the list. Default page size is 30. '> Filters the response by a specified UUID for the project. '> Filters the response by a specified service ID. '> Filters the response by a specified service type, which include compute, ec2, image, and identity. '> Filters the response by a specified user ID. '> The user ID. '> A user object. The default tenant for the new user. The user description. The ID of the domain for the user. The email address for the new user. Enables or disables the new user. To enable the user, set to true. To disable the user, set to false. Default is true. The user name. The user password. commit_message:
Make webservice as common for haproxy conf

Get rid of "horizon" name in haproxy configuration so other services will
be able to employ common webservice as well.

Change-Id: I75b732420a769bde7910632e5c3d2790c9ac41c5
Related-Bug: #1517005

commit_message:
Move label formatting to make_fs from driver

The code that truncated and formatted labels was in driver - too high up
in code hierarchy. The label is now simply passed to make_fs and it
handles it properly.

Change-Id: I87c151e4f01784101977bdd46c3e64401090fc05
Closes-Bug: #1505621

commit_message:
Add support of os_service_default fact in glance spec

   This change adds possibility to use the os_service_default
   fact for configuration options that default to '<SERVICE DEFAULT>'.
   this change is done by analogy with cinder
   commit 667e6c0850672dbbf99381eb92468f95e5591913

Change-Id: Ie5c8909bcc1c9a6a7a9ab1b59eec4637751ffd74

commit_message:
Re-assembling bond

* Now we only re-assemble bond if we change bond mode. Before we re-assembled
bond every puppet run, that is not needed and sometimes led to kernel panic.
* Refactor bond downing and upping behaviour during configuration:
we only down and up bond if we change bond configuration, if nothing is
changed - we do nothing.

Change-Id: Ie9d15c7474c27dd396ae5e46cf0e41ff25786574
Closes-bug: #1507613

commit_message:
utils.build: added helper functions for bootstrap images

* make_targz
* run_script_in_chroot
* recompress_initramfs - rebuilds initramfs image in the chroot
* run_mksquashfs - runs mksquashfs available in the chroot
* get_installed_packages - lists packages installed in the chroot
* copy_kernel_initramfs - copy/move kernel and initramfs from the chroot

Change-Id: I49eb92f0dc0303e35d7630d7690b0004a2018ccf
Implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-agent refs/changes/75/246575/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
import signalfrom fuel_agent.utils import fs as fudef folder_to_archive(d_input, d_output, name, container): if container == 'tar.gz': o_file = os.path.join(os.path.normpath(d_output), name + '.' + container) LOG.info('Creating archive: %s', o_file) try: utils.execute('tar', '-czf', o_file, '--directory', os.path.normcase(d_input), '.', logged=True) except Exception as exc: LOG.error('Failed to create archive: %s', exc) raise return o_file raise errors.WrongImageDataError( 'Error while packaging folder to archive: unsupported ' 'output container: {container}'.format(container=container)) def run_script_in_chroot(chroot, script): LOG.info('Copy user-script {0} into chroot:{1}'.format(script, chroot)) utils.execute('cp', '-r', script, chroot) LOG.info('Make user-script {0} executable:'.format(script)) utils.execute('chmod', '0755', os.path.join(chroot, os.path.basename( script))) stdout, stderr = utils.execute( 'chroot', chroot, '/bin/bash', '-c', os.path.join( '/', os.path.basename(script))) LOG.debug('Running user-script completed: 
stdout: {0}
stderr: {1}'. format(stdout, stderr)) def recompress_initramfs(chroot, compress='xz'): """Remove old and rebuild initrd :param chroot: :param compress: compression type for initrd :return: """ initrd_mask = "initrd" LOG.info('Change initramfs compression type to:{0}'.format(compress)) utils.execute( 'sed', '-i', 's/COMPRESS\s*=\s*gzip/COMPRESS={0}/'.format(compress), os.path.join(chroot, 'etc/initramfs-tools/initramfs.conf')) # remove all initrd files for file in os.listdir(os.path.join(chroot, 'boot/')): if os.path.isfile(file) and file.startswith(initrd_mask): LOG.debug('Removing file: {0}'.format(file)) os.remove(os.path.join(os.path.join(chroot, 'boot/'), file)) cmds = ['chroot', chroot, 'update-initramfs -v -c -k all'] stdout, stderr = utils.execute(*cmds, env_variables={'TMPDIR': '/tmp', 'TMP': '/tmp'}) LOG.debug('Running "update-initramfs" completed.
stdout: ' '%s
stderr: %s', stdout, stderr) def dump_mkbootstrap_yaml(metadata, c_dir, to_file=None): """Process metadata dict to nice yaml file :param c_dir: folder, where result yaml should be saved Size of result 'modules' files aslo will be calculated from this dir. """ drop_data = {'modules': {}} for module in metadata['bootstrap_modules']: fname = os.path.basename(metadata['bootstrap_modules'] [module]['uri']) fs_file = os.path.join(c_dir, fname) try: raw_size = os.path.getsize(fs_file) except IOError as exc: LOG.error('There was an error while getting file size: {0}'.format( exc)) raise raw_md5 = utils.calculate_md5(fs_file, raw_size) drop_data['modules'][module] = { 'raw_md5': raw_md5, 'raw_size': raw_size, 'file': fname, 'uri': metadata['bootstrap_modules'][module]['uri'] } drop_data['uuid'] = metadata['uuid'] drop_data['os'] = metadata['os'] drop_data['extend_kopts'] = metadata['extend_kopts'] drop_data['all_packages'] = metadata['all_packages'] drop_data['repos'] = metadata['raw_repos'] LOG.debug('Image metadata: %s', drop_data) if to_file: with open(os.path.join(c_dir, metadata['meta_file']), 'wt') as f: yaml.safe_dump(drop_data, stream=f, encoding='utf-8') return drop_data def run_mksquashfs(chroot, dstdir, compression_algorithm='xz'): """Pack the target system as squashfs using mksquashfs The kernel squashfs driver has to match with the user space squasfs tools. Use the mksquashfs provided by the target distro to achieve this. (typically the distro maintainers are smart enough to ship the correct version of mksquashfs) Mksquashfs used from available in the target system 1)Mount tmpfs under chroot/mnt 2)run mksquashfs inside a chroot 3)move result files to dstdir """ # TODO(azvyagintsev) fetch from uri driver files = {'squashfs': 'root.squashfs', 'kernel': 'vmlinuz', 'initrd': 'initrd.img' } temp = '.squashfs_tmp' s_dst = os.path.join(chroot, 'mnt/dst/') s_src = os.path.join(chroot, 'mnt/src/') try: boot_dir = os.path.join(chroot, 'boot/') # We don't need all files, only latest one. # So search latest one by mask, and copy them to dstdir, appending # temp filename for module in ('initrd', 'vmlinuz'): filelist = filter( lambda x: os.path.isfile( os.path.join(boot_dir, x)) and x.startswith (module), os.listdir(boot_dir)) newest = os.path.join(boot_dir, max( filelist, key=lambda x: os.stat( os.path.join(boot_dir, x)).st_mtime)) LOG.debug('Moving out file: {0}'.format(newest)) shutil.copy(newest, newest + temp) # Bootstrap nodes load the kernel and initramfs via the network, # therefore remove the kernel and initramfs located in root # filesystem to make the image smaller (and save the network # bandwidth and the boot time) remove_files(boot_dir, filelist) fu.mount_fs( 'tmpfs', 'mnt_{0}'.format(temp), (os.path.join(chroot, 'mnt/'.format(temp))), 'rw,nodev,nosuid,noatime,mode=0755,size=4M') utils.makedirs_if_not_exists(s_src) utils.makedirs_if_not_exists(s_dst) # Bind mount the chroot to avoid including various temporary/virtual # files (/proc, /sys, /dev, and so on) into the image fu.mount_bind(s_src, chroot, ' ') fu.mount_fs(None, None, s_src, 'remount,bind,ro') fu.mount_bind(s_dst, dstdir, ' ') # run mksquashfs utils.execute( 'chroot', chroot, 'mksquashfs', s_src.lstrip(chroot), os.path.join(s_dst.lstrip(chroot), files['squashfs']) + temp, '-comp {0}'.format(compression_algorithm), '-no-progress', '-noappend', logged=True) # move to result names # Move file with m_name* to m_name. # Example : # m_name = 'vmlinuz' # real-filename = 'vmlinuz-123-45' # result-file will be : 'vmlinuz' for m_name in six.iterkeys(files): f = filter(lambda x: os.path.join(s_dst, x)and x.startswith( m_name), os.listdir(s_dst)) shutil.move(os.path.join(s_dst, f), os.path.join(dstdir) + files[m_name]) # move to result names # # for file in six.iterkeys(files): # utils.execute( # 'find', s_dst, '-maxdepth 1', '-type', 'f', # '-iname "{0}*"'.format(files[file]), '-exec', 'sh', '-c', # '" mv -v {{}} {0}/{1} " \;'.format(os.path.normcase(dstdir), # files[file]), logged=True) except Exception as exc: LOG.error('squashfs_image build failed: %s', exc) raise finally: LOG.info('squashfs_image clean-up') stop_chrooted_processes(chroot, signal=signal.SIGTERM) fu.umount_fs(os.path.join(chroot, 'mnt/dst/')) fu.umount_fs(os.path.join(chroot, 'mnt/src/')) fu.umount_fs(os.path.join(chroot, 'mnt/')) def dpkg_list(chroot): """return simple dpkg list""" stdout, stderr = utils.execute('chroot', chroot, 'dpkg-query', '-W -f='${Package} ${Version}\t' ') # split, output will be = package - version p_list = stdout.split('	') # remove last empty '' p_list.pop() p_dict = {} for item in p_list: p_dict[item.split(' ')[0]] = item.split(' ')[1] return p_dict

commit_message:
Site create RPC

Implement site create RPC. Now tricircle api can utilize RPC
to notify cascade service to start rpc server for new site.

Partially implements: blueprint implement-api
Ref: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/implement-api

Change-Id: I73879a84d31b5ac9004cfe3f18cb9a984d53099c

[sahara] job based on direct engine only in stable/liberty

we still keep this jobs for stable/liberty. we keep heat
based jobs as is.

commit_message:
Add OpenContrail driver

That version uses the key/value store exposed by the OpenContrail
API but that's not efficient. The BGP/VPN resources and sub-association
need to be added to the OpenContrail data model.

That first PoC will be delivered to with the Liberty release but will be
replaced by a final one for Mitaka and next releases without any
migration script or method from the first PoC version.

Implements: blueprint opencontrail-bgpvpn-driver
Change-Id: I3795dd7b24afdac1cd5134c41b6b32ef8a888287
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/06/202806/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BGPVPNConnectionNotFound(q_exc.NotFound): message = _("BgpVpnConnection %(conn_id)s could not be found") class BGPVPNConnectionMissingRouteTarget(q_exc.BadRequest): message = _("BgpVpnConnection could not be created. Missing one of" " route_targets, import_targets or export_targets attribute") class BGPVPNNetworkInUse(q_exc.NetworkInUse): message = _("Unable to complete operation on network %(network_id)s. " "There are one or more BGP VPN connections associated" " to the network.")

Acceptance: use common bits from puppet-openstack-integration

Change-Id: Ie9eeefcbdcb27a92a49fcc6ce76b7e6ae817ef7b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-aodh refs/changes/28/247028/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include ::openstack_integration include ::openstack_integration::repos include ::openstack_integration::rabbitmq include ::openstack_integration::mysql include ::openstack_integration::keystone
deleted_lines: Exec { logoutput => 'on_failure' } # Common resources case $::osfamily { 'Debian': { include ::apt class { '::openstack_extras::repo::debian::ubuntu': release => 'liberty', repo => 'proposed', package_require => true, } $package_provider = 'apt' } 'RedHat': { class { '::openstack_extras::repo::redhat::redhat': manage_rdo => false, repo_hash => { 'openstack-common-testing' => { 'baseurl' => 'http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-common-testing/x86_64/os/', 'descr' => 'openstack-common-testing', 'gpgcheck' => 'no', }, 'openstack-liberty-testing' => { 'baseurl' => 'http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-liberty-testing/x86_64/os/', 'descr' => 'openstack-liberty-testing', 'gpgcheck' => 'no', }, 'openstack-liberty-trunk' => { 'baseurl' => 'http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-liberty/current-passed-ci/', 'descr' => 'openstack-liberty-trunk', 'gpgcheck' => 'no', }, }, } package { 'openstack-selinux': ensure => 'latest' } $package_provider = 'yum' } default: { fail("Unsupported osfamily (${::osfamily})") } } class { '::mysql::server': } class { '::rabbitmq': delete_guest_user => true, package_provider => $package_provider, } rabbitmq_vhost { '/': provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['rabbitmq'], } # Keystone resources, needed by Ceilometer to run class { '::keystone::db::mysql': password => 'keystone', } class { '::keystone': verbose => true, debug => true, database_connection => 'mysql://keystone:keystone@127.0.0.1/keystone', admin_token => 'admin_token', enabled => true, } class { '::keystone::roles::admin': email => 'test@example.tld', password => 'a_big_secret', } class { '::keystone::endpoint': public_url => "https://${::fqdn}:5000/", admin_url => "https://${::fqdn}:35357/", }

commit_message:
Fix path to nailgun-agent

nailgun-agent package was updated and agent was renamed to
nailgun-agent [1, 2]. So we need to update path both for
CentOS and Ubuntu packages

[1]. https://github.com/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent/blob/master/specs/fuel-nailgun-agent.spec#L37
[2]. https://github.com/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent/blob/master/debian/rules#L12

Change-Id: Ia9ecdd96bb2eb989c2bcfb3cd51efbfd12e8f9ea
Closes-bug: #1492449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/63/247463/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: flock -w 0 -o /var/lock/agent.lock -c "/usr/bin/nailgun-agent >> /var/log/nailgun-agent.log 2>&1" || true

commit_message:
carbonara: optimize _first_block_timestamp

Leverage _round_timestamp which is a lot faster than faking a resample
using Pandas.

Change-Id: I05709a728f1605227a80e2347a9436fc6bfcf832
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/97/245797/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @staticmethod def _round_timestamp(ts, freq): return pandas.Timestamp( (ts.value // freq.delta.value) * freq.delta.value) rounded = self._round_timestamp(self.ts.index[-1], self.block_size) return rounded - (self.block_size * self.back_window)
deleted_lines: ts = self.ts[-1:].resample(self.block_size) return (ts.index[-1] - (self.block_size * self.back_window)) @staticmethod def _round_timestamp(ts, freq): return pandas.Timestamp( (ts.value // freq.delta.value) * freq.delta.value)

commit_message:
storage: support storage upgrade

This is more a conceptual placeholder now since no storage needs
upgrading (yet).

Change-Id: I50091cd58030590bc64ca62faea74b873b49155d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/70/245070/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.info("Upgrading indexer %s" % index) s = storage.get_driver(conf) LOG.info("Upgrading storage %s" % s) s.upgrade(index)

commit_message:
Rename dbsync to upgrade

The tool is actually used to upgrade the indexer, and might be later
used to upgrade the storage engine too.

Change-Id: I7266397209e814dec5eb732804bcdc022943b33d

commit_message:
Set bash interpreter explicitely for ci hooks

CI config requires explicit definition of bash interpreter.
So, we need to add explicit definition to one of three files
that are used in CI jobs - 'contrib/ci/common.sh'.

Change-Id: Ie387ac778ad65811e734bba41c9525bda3913cd9

commit_message:
Specifying target provision states in fsm

In ironic, a state can be associated with a target state, and these
associations are defined when the fsm is created. This patch adds
the ability to override these default target states when initializing
the fsm as well as when processing an event that transitions the fsm
to a new state (and target state).

This is useful, for example, when adding the manual clean feature,
which causes a node to go from manageable -> clean* -> manageble
instead of the default behaviour (for automated cleaning) of
-> clean* -> available.

Change-Id: I0a7c9be0e44b75f8bd2ebfefd3fb710109612578
Implements: blueprint manual-cleaning

commit_message:
Fix metadata storage

After recent changes BackupJob.get_metadata also returns information about storage.
But before this patch, I was replacing conf.storage from string (swift, local, ssh) to actual object (SwiftStorage, LocalStorage, SshStorage).
So in get_metadata we were trying to serialize object instead of string.
 This patch fixes that by leaving conf.storage as a string and providing to Job storage as dedicated parameter.

Incompatibilities: tests/test_job.py

Change-Id: I0869b7d432e8f8a7f0839e4670a8845bf932e69c
(cherry picked from commit 5d577d043a4c192a8446b930447dafef0ad586dc)

commit_message:
Support arguments for clean step methods

With this change, a clean step method used for manual cleaning can take
keyword arguments.

This adds an optional argsinfo parameter to the clean_step decorator.
Its value is a dictionary of keyword arguments where key is the name
of the argument and value is a dictionary as follows:
- ‘description’: <description>. This should include possible values.
- ‘required’: Boolean. True if this argument is required. If so, it
  must be specified in the clean request; false if it is optional.

Change-Id: I3bcf1a5a91f06b19d917be2bf7acb035801f9193
Implements: blueprint manual-cleaning

commit_message:
Validate all tcp/udp port numbers

We introduced a common port validation method
validate_network_port, this patch try to validate
all port parameters using it.

Change-Id: I209b89d2a4c2bbc5619d058f78da2f5f76d1723c

commit_message:
Compatibility with a coming puppet-heat fix

There is a fix coming into puppet-heat to ensure correct dependencies
within heat::keystone::domain class. This means the relationship with
Keystone_domain[heat_domain] will stop working. We should depend on the
whole class instead.

Change-Id: Ic541f11978908f9344e5590f3961f0d31c04bb0c
Depends-On: I9078be31f26e454e0686debcefa070721767a581

added_lines: Generating a default configuration ---------------------------------- Some users might want to use a 'generic' configuration for bandit. Using 'bandit-config-generator', it is possible to generate such a configuration without writing a whole bandit.yaml. Instead, one can write a minimal configuration file (named 'minimal.yaml', for instance) that looks like this: .. code-block:: yaml profile_name: my-bandit-config exclude_checkers: [assert_used, try_except_pass] Then, it is possible to call 'bandit-config-generator' to generate a valid configuration: .. code-block:: bash bandit-config-generator --out my-bandit.yaml bandit.yaml minimal.yaml Where 'bandit.yaml' is the full configuration example provided by bandit. The following options are available: +---------------------+------------------------------------------------------+ | Option | Description | +=====================+======================================================+ | profile_name | The name of the profile that will be generated | +---------------------+------------------------------------------------------+ | exclude_checkers | A list of strings, which if found in the path will | +---------------------+------------------------------------------------------+

commit_message:
WIP: domain_name defines the Keystone_domain resource name

Before I9078be31f26e454e0686debcefa070721767a581 the Keystone_domain
resource was always named 'heat_domain'.

We customize the domain_name into 'heat_stack' instead [1]

1. https://github.com/openstack/instack-undercloud/blob/master/elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template#L93

Change-Id: I28cda7506439c8bb5644107f529c14d07ecc030e
Closes-Bug: 1518286

Remove unneeded volume serialization

It looks like this serialization introduced
because of some rebase, anyway it's clear that
it's unneeded.

Closes-bug: 1494650

commit_message:
Support unmounting shares on cluster update

When we update the shares on a cluster, we are now
calling the unmount_shares routine anytime we have
removed shares from the cluster.

Change-Id: Id028df9d09b8d603500b80af14fdf3be2ddde4d3
Partial-Implements: bp sahara-add-shares-to-clusters
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/13/247713/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Any shares that were on the original, but not on the updated # list will be unmounted unmount_list = [share for share in original_shares if share not in update_shares] if len(unmount_list) > 0: shares.unmount_shares(r.ClusterResource(updated_cluster), unmount_list)

of magnumclient.

commit_message:
Cleanup baymodel operations in conductor api

Cleanup baymodel operations in conductor/api.py which are never
been called.

Magnum do not need to call conductor (rpc call) to do any operation
for baymodel. All baymodel related operations are DB operation.

Closes-Bug: #1517338
Change-Id: If5078efd71eaf57b8700e0c8097c89386583cf02

commit_message:
Add a function to generate fernet keys for keystone.

- "generate_fernet_keys" function was added to generate fernet keys
for keystone. For key generation was used "openssl" tool.

Implements blueprint: fernet-tokens-support

Change-Id: Ia80c554b8514adc103ccbd8310b696d2357bfe96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/95/247495/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: while getopts ":i:o:s:f:p:" opt; do f) fernet_keys=$OPTARG ;; [ -z ${keys_path} ] && keys_path="/var/lib/fuel/keys" function generate_fernet_keys { for i in $fernet_keys do local dir_path=${BASE_PATH}fernet-keys/ local key_path=$dir_path$i mkdir -p $dir_path if [ ! -f $key_path ]; then #TODO:Its deprecated and should be replaced in a next release with a native #keystone fernet key tool generator. openssl rand -base64 32 -out $key_path 2>&1 else echo "Key $key_path already exists" fi done } generate_fernet_keys

commit_message:
Enable libvirt AppArmor protection

This is Security vulnerability fix. libvirt AppArmor protection should be
enabled by default.

It enables apparmor security_driver in libvirt/qemu and disables Unix domain
sockets protection in the AppArmor for libvirt only for Ubuntu Linux.

Change-Id: I75a35b5602028b04e0f547b06eff29d9dbf43a6b
Doc-Impact: ops
Closes-Bug: #1509314

commit_message:
Add Searchlight specs repo

After disussion on the Searchlight team [1], we've decided
to add a specs repo for managing non-trivial features.

Project config change has been submitted:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/244836/

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/openstack_search/
    2015/openstack_search.2015-11-12-15.03.log.html

Change-Id: I55294e10195b96f7f020d131da28a753b40c65ae

commit_message:
Added new projects for OpenStack-Ansible

This updates governance for new roles that will be coming online
as the OpenStack-Ansible moves to break out our roles from the
main repo.

Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Depends-On: Ibfd5e745b7c5836b1c421b06ff8ef1e122c14108
Change-Id: I63a999bdfae487f05e9918a2817433c6e026e79f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
os-vif: add openstack/os-vif repository under Nova team

os-vif is a project to define an object model and plugin system
to integrate OpenStack network providers (eg Neutron) and
OpenStack compute providers (eg Nova)

It will be developed jointly by representatives from both the
Nova and Neutron teams, but for the sake of governance Nova is
set as the owner.

Change-Id: Ife95bea0cba68901a8c820c4f32a9782d5735beb
Depends-on: Ifc2c1a3198075aafc3fd97f0c5355eb27ba8bc19

subject: Add assert:supports-rolling-upgrade to nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-10 21:45:03.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/65cec4a6a9e914b4b79b3a44564aba5679e5ca5b', 'message': 'Add assert:supports-rolling-upgrade to nova

Nova has:
 - Asserted assert:supports-rolling-upgrade
 - Has a defined plan for operators to upgrade individual compute resources
   separately from control services, eliminating the need to restart the
   entire deployment all at once.
 - Has had full-stack testing of mixed-version mid-upgrade services in its
   gate consistently for several releases.

Change-Id: I79e50b2345adeb15d729f348c36b6a5808dfa37d
'}]
commit_message:
Add assert:supports-rolling-upgrade to nova

Nova has:
 - Asserted assert:supports-rolling-upgrade
 - Has a defined plan for operators to upgrade individual compute resources
   separately from control services, eliminating the need to restart the
   entire deployment all at once.
 - Has had full-stack testing of mixed-version mid-upgrade services in its
   gate consistently for several releases.

Change-Id: I79e50b2345adeb15d729f348c36b6a5808dfa37d

commit_message:
Add assert:supports-upgrade to nova

Nova has stable configuration changes, database schema upgrades, a defined
upgrade process that doesn't change, and always includes upgrade details
in the release notes. These statements have been consistently true for
the last several cycles.

Change-Id: I31d0f50fe4e7864dd8ef505c429f9df40520f238

commit_message:
Fix floating ip setting name in samples

The sample files reference the setting 'use_floatingip' which never
gets set, as the code is looking for 'use_floating_ip' instead.

Change-Id: If55b3ac6722e13886f09cce09cf2c4cc0fb73f77

commit_message:
Add a tool that allows visualizing the projects as a graph

This tool, when ran can create diagrams that show what
exactly the big-tent is and/or what the subprojects/deliverables
a project produces are.

For example, here is the way to create a output for ironic
and its deliverables:

$ python tools/universe_dot.py  reference/projects.yaml \
  ironic_universe.dot ironic;

$ neato -Tsvg ironic_universe.dot > ironic_universe.svg

Then view svg as is, or convert to png or other...

This requires pydot2 and pyyaml to be installed to work.

Change-Id: Idcd73f9e678e200d65eda4d1d54f1156fd18853b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/29/232729/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import sys import time import pydot import six import yaml def skip_deliverable(project_name, deliverable_name): if project_name == deliverable_name: return True spec_name = "%s-specs" % project_name if spec_name == deliverable_name: return True return False projects_file = sys.argv[1] output_dot_file = sys.argv[2] just_projects = set(sys.argv[3:]) print("Reading projects from '%s'" % projects_file) with open(projects_file, 'rb') as fh: projects = yaml.safe_load(fh) project_names = sorted(six.iterkeys(projects)) if just_projects: print("Restricting to just %s projects" % list(just_projects)) for project_name in list(project_names): if project_name not in just_projects: project_names.remove(project_name) project_names = tuple(project_names) graph_nodes = {} start = time.time() print("Constructing nodes.") print("Please wait...") node_attrs = { 'fontsize': '11', } node_count = 0 edges_needed = 0 for project_name in project_names: node = pydot.Node(name=project_name) node_count += 1 graph_nodes[project_name] = node deliverables = projects[project_name].get('deliverables', []) deliverable_names = sorted(six.iterkeys(deliverables)) for deliverable_name in deliverable_names: if not skip_deliverable(project_name, deliverable_name): edges_needed += 1 node_path = "%s/%s" % (project_name, deliverable_name) node = pydot.Node(name=deliverable_name, **node_attrs) graph_nodes[node_path] = node print("Inserting %s nodes and %s edges into" " a new graph." % (node_count, edges_needed)) print("Please wait...") graph_kwargs = { 'rankdir': 'LR', 'nodesep': '0.25', 'overlap': 'false', 'ranksep': '0.5', 'splines': 'true', 'ordering': 'in', 'graph_name': 'OpenStack Universe', } graph = pydot.Graph(**graph_kwargs) for project_name in project_names: print(" Inserting nodes for '%s'" % project_name) node = graph_nodes[project_name] graph.add_node(node) deliverables = projects[project_name].get('deliverables', []) deliverable_names = sorted(six.iterkeys(deliverables)) for deliverable_name in deliverable_names: if not skip_deliverable(project_name, deliverable_name): print(" Inserting node for '%s'" % deliverable_name) node_path = "%s/%s" % (project_name, deliverable_name) deliverable_node = graph_nodes[node_path] graph.add_node(deliverable_node) print(" Inserting edge for '%s' -> '%s'" % (project_name, deliverable_name)) graph.add_edge(pydot.Edge(node, deliverable_node, style='dotted')) end = time.time() print("Finished in %0.2f seconds" % (end - start)) print("Writing graph to '%s'" % output_dot_file) with open(output_dot_file, "wb") as fh: fh.write(graph.to_string())

commit_message:
[Spec] Enable users to specify nodes for provisioning and/or deployment

Related to blueprint allow-choosing-nodes-for-provisioning-and-deployment

Change-Id: Iec281a740c92378c7df4075bb6a995199513f5e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/93/228493/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================== Support for separate provisioning and deployment in UI ====================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/support-separate-provisioning-and-deployment-in-ui It is now possible to run provisioning only without deploy via CLI, the same functionality is needed to be supported from Fuel UI. -------------------- Problem description -------------------- In large cluster it might be important to find errors early, without long-running deployment step. So that when provisioning fails, there won't be no need in starting deployment. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- Web UI ====== tbd Add a button on Dashboard tab to provision all nodes. Nailgun ======= None Data model ---------- None REST API -------- None Orchestration ============= None RPC Protocol ------------ None Fuel Client =========== None Plugins ======= None Fuel Library ============ None ------------ Alternatives ------------ None -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- None --------------- Security impact --------------- None -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- Notification of successful or error provisioning should be added. --------------- End user impact --------------- User will now have an ability to provision all nodes in the cluster independently from deploying cluster. ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ None ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- Deployment process will slightly change, with th one major change - ability to deploy already provisioned nodes. (tbd - will it be possible to run old classic deploy & provisioning?) ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- None -------------------------------- Infrastructure/operations impact -------------------------------- None -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- Documentation should be changed according to new ability added -------------------- Expected OSCI impact -------------------- None -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Primary assignee: Aleksandra Morozova, astepanchuk (astepanchuk@mirantis.com) Visual design: Bogdan Dudko, bdudko (bdudko@mirantis.com) Mandatory design review: Vitaly Kramskikh, vkramskikh (vkramskikh@mirantis.com) Work Items ========== #. Visual design clarification and implementation #. UI logics implementation #. New notifications should be implemented and shown Dependencies ============ None ------------ Testing, QA ------------ #. Manual testing - we should check that nodes have new status - provisioned #. UI functional tests should be implemented Acceptance criteria =================== *. It is possible to run provisioning seperately from deployment ---------- References ----------

commit_message:
Refactor of keystone_domain provider.

This remove the @@default_domain_id from the code.  It is no longer
necessary to have a global class variable sharing this id.  All is now
encapsulated inside the keystone_domain class.

The change come mainly from the new policy regarding default domain[1]
which simplifies the logic, and the code.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/keystone_no_domain

Change-Id: I71ab37165db6b0fe8472e7dfc8abcf72e0caac4a

commit_message:
Fix metadata storage

After recent changes BackupJob.get_metadata also returns information about storage.
But before this patch, I was replacing conf.storage from string (swift, local, ssh) to actual object (SwiftStorage, LocalStorage, SshStorage).
So in get_metadata we were trying to serialize object instead of string.
 This patch fixes that by leaving conf.storage as a string and providing to Job storage as dedicated parameter.

Change-Id: I0869b7d432e8f8a7f0839e4670a8845bf932e69c

commit_message:
Explicitly set fuel-library version to PRODUCT_VERSION

This works around a case where fuel-library has multiple
versions available, but we only want to ensure that the
version PRODUCT_VERSION is installed by anaconda.

Change-Id: I2681123ec508d11d90264f914fa25a68b6e5e7bb
Closes-Bug: #1509313
(cherry picked from commit 29ddb1e4a71e80c9ce3e77c71d382a165baf6523)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/52/239952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: fuel-library >= {{PRODUCT_VERSION}}

commit_message:
Fix for getting glance command list

Usual command uses xxxx --help for getting command list.
but glance case, it need to use help not --help.
For this purpose, adds if branch.
This patch is needed for complete/bash-completion switch.

glance is not viewed "Subcommands" list at header
  glance (Subcommands does not exist)
  http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/content/glanceclient_commands.html
  cinder (Subcommands exist)
  http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/content/cinderclient_commands.html
For this purpose, add glance switch for "Subcommands".

Change-Id: I33251e5ada49c6e2228d5d08aa5f2c5fd86da8bb
Closes-Bug: #1517756
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/29/247329/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if os_command == "glance": help_lines = subprocess.check_output([os_command, "help"], universal_newlines=True, stderr=DEVNULL).split('\n') else: help_lines = subprocess.check_output([os_command, "--help"],

commit_message:
Use SIGUSR1 to notify l3 agent of changing prefix file

It is common for all OpenStack services to use SIGHUP signal to
reload configuration and restart. This functionality, including
defining signal handler, is defined by oslo.service.

Meanwhile, this is currently not so for l3 agent. PrefixDelegation
class that is instantiated in L3NATAgent overrides handler for SIGHUP,
thus removing handler that was set in oslo.service.

The proposed solution is to use another signal, such as SIGUSR1,
instead of SIGHUP to notify l3 agent that a prefix file was
somehow changed.

Added a functional test for restarting L3 agent using SIGHUP.

Change-Id: I48eb4697a5fad97bcf08cfe1f80921a46d94029d
Closes-Bug: #1511401
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/67/240267/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Vrácení..." #, python-formatmsgid "Volume type will be changed to be the same as the source volume." msgstr "Typ svazku bude změněn aby odpovídal typu zdrojového svazku" msgid "Volume: %s is in use, can't retype." msgstr "Svazek %s se používá, nelze přetypovat." #, python-formatmsgid "refresh stale ssc job in progress. Returning... " msgstr "Úkol obnovy starého ssc probíhá. Vrácení..." msgid "ssc job in progress. Returning... " msgstr "Úkol ssc probíhá. Vrácení..." #, python-format msgid "" "zfssa_initiator: %(ini)s wont be used on zfssa_initiator_group= %(inigrp)s." msgstr "" "Zavaděč zfssa: %(ini)s nebude použit ve skupině zavaděče zfssa= %(inigrp)s." msgid "" "zfssa_initiator_config not found. Using deprecated configuration options." msgstr "zfssa_initiator_config nenalezeno. Použity zastaralé volby nastavení."

commit_message:
doc: document override_defaults phase

override_defaults phase was added to devstack in [1]
but documentation was pending. This patch adds the
same. For history around override_defaults, one can
refer to the mail thread [2]

Also fixes a small typo

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167933/
[2]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-March/059621.html

Change-Id: I1b58ca0ce0e4b85a1dbd710b4c426606fd4dcf45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/75/246775/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: override_defaults | source | stack | unstack | clean override_defaults: always called first in any of the scripts, used to override defaults (if need be) that are otherwise set in lib/* scripts source: called by stack.sh. Used to set the initial defaults in a lib/* script or similar
deleted_lines: source | stack | unstack | clean source: always called first in any of the scripts, used to set the initial defaults in a lib/* script or similar

commit_message:
Refactoring HP LeftHand Cinder Driver to be HPE

The HP LeftHand Cinder driver was recently refactored to be HPE.

The same refactoring is being done to the documentation with
this patch. It is being done because the company managing the HP
LeftHand Cinder driver is now Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE).

Closes-Bug: #1517648
Change-Id: Ibe4d4ff73591348fcf5997984e89d0a895172f6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/33/247233/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <section xml:id="HPE-LeftHand-StoreVirtual-driver" xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" <title>HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual driver</title> <filename>HPELeftHandISCSIDriver</filename> are run by communicating with the HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual system over <package>python-lefthandclient</package>, <filename>HPELeftHandISCSIDriver</filename> communicate with the HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual array, or standard mode configured for standard mode, the <package>python-lefthandclient</package> must be downloaded, and HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual Operating System <xref linkend="hpe-lefthand-rest-driver" />. <xref linkend="hpe-lefthand-clix-driver" />. <para>For information about how to manage HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual storage systems, see the HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual user documentation. <section xml:id="hpe-lefthand-rest-driver"> <title>HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual REST driver standard mode</title> <para>This section describes how to configure the HPE <section xml:id="hpe-lefthand-sys-reqs"> <para>To use the HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual driver in standard mode, software version 11.5 or higher on the HPE Install the <package>python-lefthandclient</package> version 2.0.0 from the Python Package Index on the system with the <section xml:id="hpe-lefthand-supported-ops-rest"> the same HPE LeftHand/StoreVirtual management group. commit_message:
Change format of returning message

* When no free IP addresses are available in public network, Nailgun should
  return error message in a way which is acceptable by Fuel UI.
* Update corresponding unit test.

Change-Id: I9a2689c134bb4157d81f0749db495ec66d399118
Partial-bug: #1513774

added_lines: from nailgun.db.sqlalchemy.models import NetworkGroup # NOTE: the exception can be raised only when no free IP addresses # in public network public_ng = db().query(NetworkGroup).filter_by( name="public").first() raise self.http( 400, six.text_type(exc), err_list=[{"errors": ["ip_ranges"], "ids": [public_ng.id]}] )

commit_message:
Implement API service & dependencies

This patch rewrite puppet-gnocchi to be compliant with other modules.
It takes example at how puppet-aodh was written.

* Update init.pp to match Gnocchi requirements
* Update config.pp
* Add policy.pp
* Add storage.pp for carbonara
* Update db configuration
* Update keystone/auth.pp
* Add acceptance for API service for Centos only (not packaged on Ubuntu)
* Update unit tests

Change-Id: I82400b1e30f3700ab7a3d006b6bb143351bcc830
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-gnocchi refs/changes/11/238811/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # == Class: gnocchi::keystone::auth# (required) Password for gnocchi user.# Username for gnocchi service. Defaults to 'gnocchi'.# Email for gnocchi user. Defaults to 'gnocchi@localhost'.# Tenant for gnocchi user. Defaults to 'services'.# Should gnocchi endpoint be configured? Defaults to 'true'.# (Optional) Should the service user be configured? # Defaults to 'true'.# (Optional) Should the admin role be configured for the service user? # Defaults to 'true'.# Type of service. Defaults to 'key-manager'.# [*service_name*] # (optional) Name of the service. # Defaults to the value of auth_name. # # [*public_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's public url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:8041') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. # # [*admin_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's admin url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:8041') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. # # [*internal_url*] # (optional) The endpoint's internal url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:8041') # This url should *not* contain any trailing '/'. $service_name = undef, $service_type = 'metric', $region = 'RegionOne', $public_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:8041', $internal_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:8041', $admin_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:8041', $real_service_name = pick($service_name, $auth_name) keystone::resource::service_identity { 'gnocchi': configure_user => $configure_user, configure_user_role => $configure_user_role, service_name => $real_service_name, service_description => 'OpenStack Metric Service', auth_name => $auth_name, public_url => $public_url, internal_url => $internal_url, admin_url => $admin_url,

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # gnocchi::keystone::auth# (required) Password for Gnocchi user.# Username for Gnocchi service. Defaults to 'gnocchi'.# Email for Gnocchi user. Defaults to 'gnocchi@localhost'.# Tenant for Gnocchi user. Defaults to 'services'.# Should Gnocchi endpoint be configured? Defaults to 'true'.# Should Gnocchi user be configured? Defaults to 'true'.# Should Gnocchi user/role association be configured? Defaults to 'true'.# Type of service. Defaults to 'gnocchi'. # # [*service_description*] # Description for keystone service. Optional. Defaults to 'OpenStack Datapoint Service'. # # [*public_protocol*] # Protocol for public endpoint. Defaults to 'http'. # # [*public_address*] # Public address for endpoint. Defaults to '127.0.0.1'. # # [*public_port*] # Port for public endpoint. # Defaults to '8041'. # # [*admin_protocol*] # Protocol for admin endpoint. Defaults to 'http'. # # [*admin_address*] # Admin address for endpoint. subject: Fix the bug of can't get the desired image info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-14 07:37:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/11308e7fbc8ca54fdccc72557aa63aea0c8ae5e5', 'message': "Fix the bug of can't get the desired image info

The current imageutils.QemuImgInfo class parse all the image info
at first, but if one of the info is unavailable, it would raise a
ValueError.

Sometimes, user only care one of the info which is really
available, but it may be failed because of the ValueError which is
caused by another unavailable info.

This patch resolves the problem by parsing each of the info separately,
so that getting the desired image info will not be influenced by other
unavailable info.

For more information, please visit the bug reporting message.

commit_message:
Fix the bug of can't get the desired image info

The current imageutils.QemuImgInfo class parse all the image info
at first, but if one of the info is unavailable, it would raise a
ValueError.

Sometimes, user only care one of the info which is really
available, but it may be failed because of the ValueError which is
caused by another unavailable info.

This patch resolves the problem by parsing each of the info separately,
so that getting the desired image info will not be influenced by other
unavailable info.

I have committed this patch to cinder, here is Change-Id:
Change-Id: Ic5f3b80e172baaafc07432319f8aa24bf117b392

Change-Id: I3692da15db6ee99edceb856643628b76a28ad270
Closes-Bug: #1516206
