commit_message:
Refactor VPN functional tests to use common template

This will change the existing functional test jobs to use a common job
template. To do this the following steps were taken:

- Make the jobs non-voting, so they don't break the gate. This means
  that reviewers need to check the non-voting results, prior to +A.

- Removed experimental functional jobs that were previously created,
  in neutron-vpnaas repos. These jobs were going to replace the existing
  ones (but do the same thing). Aborting that approach.

- Remove the experimental API job. A separate commit will add it back
  in, and use the new common template, as part of work to getting the
  API job working.

Partial-Bug: #1495584

Change-Id: I015bb7727676a68b1dfc3f04d10a80a308b00435

commit_message:
Create a multinode grenade job for testing Neutron

This job will be used to begin testing Neutron's ability to live-upgrade

Change-Id: Id3d88e41e449966e3ac727cf76157f0cbb53ea8a

added_lines: name: '{pipeline}-grenade-dsvm-neutron-multinode{job-suffix}' node: '{node}' wrappers: - build-timeout: timeout: 125 - timestamps builders: - link-logs - net-info - devstack-checkout - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT=120 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_CONFIGDRIVE=0 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_FULL=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_GRENADE=pullup # Default to non DVR export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON_DVR=0 export BRANCH_OVERRIDE={branch-override} if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi export DEVSTACK_GATE_TOPOLOGY="multinode" cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh publishers: - devstack-logs - console-log - job-template:

commit_message:
Remove unused Manila CI job

This commit reverts change [1] as it was needed only temporarely.
Now, job 'gate-manila-tempest-dsvm-tempest-plugin' is not needed anymore
and should be removed.

[1] I6af7ae7f697d2c9ffaac808b0d8283fbcf8c622a

Change-Id: Ibeced80dfc576c78ff13d468f2fb6a4fcbd29e2e

commit_message:
Preserve data on Ceph OSD devices

Set reinstall_node flag in the deployment information for ceph-osd nodes to
ensure that Puppet keeps the existing OSD data set.

Closes-bug: 1503424
Change-Id: I4ddd7b6ba3077ad32961079eebbaf719521bf47a

commit_message:
Live Migration Automatic Block Migration

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/live-migration-auto-block-migrate

Currently when doing live migration the end-user must specify whether to
use block migration or not.  This requires them to know whether or not the
instance storage is shared between the compute nodes.  It would be simpler and
more reliable if nova figured this out for itself.

Change-Id: I3c25182cdab757b06c0594c4a67653fb5c8e8a00
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/38/247738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================================================== Live Migration Automatic Block Migration =============================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/live-migration-auto-block-migrate Currently when doing live migration the end-user must specify whether to use block migration or not. This requires them to know whether or not the instance storage is shared between the compute nodes. It would be simpler and more reliable if nova figured this out for itself. Problem description =================== The REST API for requesting live migration requires the user to set the "block_migration" parameter, which tells nova whether or not the source and destination hosts share instance storage. This is problematic because it requires the end-user to have intimate knowledge of the topology of the compute nodes, especially if there are multiple separate storage pools, or if some compute nodes have shared storage and some don't. It would be more foolproof (and simpler for the end-user) if nova could figure out automatically whether or not the source and destination share instance storage. This would allow us to completely remove the "block_migration" parameter from the live-migration request. Use Cases --------- As an end-user, I do not want to have to specify whether or not storage is shared between source and destination compute node. Proposed change =============== The proposal is to have nova figure out whether storage is shared between live migration host and guest instead of having the end-user specify it manually. In compute.manager.ComputeManager.check_can_live_migrate_destination() we currently call compute.manager.ComputeManager.check_can_live_migrate_source(). As part of check_can_live_migrate_source() we could create a new zero-size test file using uuid to guarantee uniquness. The filename would be included in the migrate_data returned by check_can_live_migrate_source(). After returning, to check_can_live_migrate_destination() we could test whether or not the new file is visible and set the block_migration flag accordingly as well as returning it in migrate_data for use by the rest of the migration code path. If it turns out that the block_migration flag is needed by one of the drivers in self.driver.check_can_live_migrate_destination(), then we might have to introduce a new RPC call specifically for determining whether storage is shared. Alternatives ------------ We could use an passwordless-ssh-based mechanism similar to that used by cold migration, but we're trying to get away from that so I don't think we'd want to go that route. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- In the live migration request, the "block_migration" parameter would no longer be specified. (Full documentation to come later.) The API microversion would be bumped accordingly. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None if we can leverage the existing RPC calls. One additional round-trip from destination to source host if we need a new RPC call. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- Maybe eventually remove support for block_migration in the API. (If we ever bump the minimum microversion.) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: cfriesen Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * Add support to automatically determine if storage is shared. * Bump the microversion. * Add unit tests for the new microversion success and exception cases. * Add functional tests for the new microversion. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= We'll need unit tests to check that the behaviour is as expected with microversion before and after removing the "block_migration" flag. The flag should work with an earlier microversion and cause an exception with the new microversion. We'll need to modify some of the existing unit tests to allow them to determine whether storage is shared instead of having it be passed in. We'll probably want to add functional/tempest tests to cover booting with the new microversion. Documentation Impact ==================== Documentation will need to be updated to reflect the new behaviour. References ========== None History ======= None

subject: Use sudo -H -E when running pip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-04 19:37:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/298c6ac41121575c05a8edfaef68191368af1ab3', 'message': 'Use sudo -H not -E when running pip

-E will result in pip writing to the current users disk cache, and
that prevents future non-root pip calls using it properly.

Change-Id: Ib70b3d59a20967bc7e08c70387eb7dd6f7f1b5c5
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-07 05:25:54.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/env-setup.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/4148a5a621d7e03948b6765b05adb66b9c88bd13', 'message': 'Use sudo -H -E when running pip

-E will result in pip writing to the current users disk cache, and
that prevents future non-root pip calls using it properly.

Change-Id: Ib70b3d59a20967bc7e08c70387eb7dd6f7f1b5c5
'}]
commit_message:
Use sudo -H -E when running pip

-E will result in pip writing to the current users disk cache, and
that prevents future non-root pip calls using it properly.

Change-Id: Ib70b3d59a20967bc7e08c70387eb7dd6f7f1b5c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/27/230827/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo -H pip install -r "$(dirname $0)/../requirements.txt"

commit_message:
mask X-Auth-Key for log_curl_request

We only mask the X-Auth-Token, but leave X-Auth-Key uncoverd, it
needs to be fixed.

Change-Id: I99dfcbe87ac33e4b1180511f5aba88b6c7be6a50
